definition: erhua variant of 寶貝|宝贝[bao3 bei4]

sentences.english: Hey,my sweetheart,time to get up for school.
sentences.chinese: 嘿，寶貝兒，該起牀上學了。

sentences.english: She hurried back to their home with her precious son.
sentences.chinese: 她匆匆忙忙地把她的寶貝兒子帶回家。

sentences.english: I want my son to understand that.
sentences.chinese: 我希望我的寶貝兒子也能理解這個道理。

sentences.english: Rodger is fathoms deep in love with his wife.
sentences.chinese: 羅傑是他母親的寶貝兒。

sentences.english: Catherine, why are you crying, love?
sentences.chinese: 凱瑟琳，你幹嗎哭呀，寶貝兒？

sentences.english: Don't say so, baby. I won't ask you for the repayment.
sentences.chinese: 別這麼說，寶貝兒，我不圖你給我回報。

sentences.english: Would you like vegetable soup or chili for dinner tonight?
sentences.chinese: 寶貝兒，晚飯來點蔬菜湯還是紅辣椒？

sentences.english: Goodness, doll, you're shaking like a leaf.
sentences.chinese: 天啊，寶貝兒，你抖起來像風中的落葉。

sentences.english: Don't remember from when, baby George started protesting against our NOs.
sentences.chinese: 不記得從什麼時候開始，寶貝兒就學會了撒潑耍賴。
“寶貝兒，你做的不錯，”我輕聲道。

sentences.english: Go to sleep, now, dear love, 'neath roses above.
sentences.chinese: 睡覺吧，寶貝兒，躺在玫瑰花牀上。

sentences.english: The baby looked at me and smiled.
sentences.chinese: 只見寶貝兒揚起小臉兒衝媽媽得意地笑。

sentences.english: Would you like to mow the yard or sweep the sidewalk?
sentences.chinese: 寶貝兒，你希望修剪院子裏的草坪還是掃過道？

sentences.english: Frieda: Baby, I think you're all yap and no zap.
sentences.chinese: 寶貝兒，我覺着你是光說不練啊。

definition: overwhelmed by favor from superior (humble expr.)
see you tomorrow/(coll., jocular) food that passes through the digestive system more or less intact (esp. enoki mushrooms)
to talk drivel/to make irresponsible remarks
to be green with envy (neologism c. 2009)
to amuse oneself/to clown around/to provoke laughter
to leap and frisk about (idiom); lively/healthy and active
